title: The biggest NBA carry jobs in league history
description: Who carried their team to the finals with the least help?
hed: The biggest NBA carry jobs in league history
dek: Who carried their team to the finals with the least help?
prompt: What do you think is the biggest NBA finals carry-job in league history?

intro.value: Despite being a team sport, some NBA teams rely on a star to get them to the finals more than others. Did Giannis do it without help? Not really. Did MJ carry Pippen? Sometimes. Is LeBron amazing? Yes.

There are plenty of opinionated articles and videos debating this already. So I figured I would add my data-driven take to the mix. What do “the numbers” say about ranking the biggest playoff carry jobs in NBA history?
Without burying the lede, the biggest carry job ever was LeBron’s (losing) effort with Cleveland in 2018.

value.caption: Artistic interpretation of LeBron carrying Kyle Korver (others not pictured).

explore.value: To answer this question with data, I used the all-in-one advanced stat RAPTOR WAR created by 538. But we can’t just measure who had the highest Wins Above Replacement in isolation since games and minutes played have an impact. It needs to be relative to the rest of the team who had the same opportunity,

Scrub through the years and teams in the chart. You’ll start to notice that teams with more distributed player impact are clustered closer together, and those with stand out performances separate from the pack. The Pistons in 2005 represents the heralded “no superstars” mentality.
The Bulls in 1998 or the Lakers in 2020 demonstrate the two-star system.
Then finally the single-handed carries, our Duncan leading the Spurs in 2003. Wade with the Heat in 2006. And LeBron basically every year, but notably in 2018 with the Cavs.
